title: Description
text: added tests code changed/added added documentation code changed/added made sure naming new functions self-explanatory consistent

title: Converting a gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment object into a PharmacoSet
text: PharmacoGx package popular tool Bioconductor project within field bioinformatics computational biology. Whereas gDR package valuable tool provides framework import, processing, analysism visualization high-dimensional drug response data, PharmacoGx package provides functionality containerize processed drug response genomic data perform pharmacogenomic analyses. data structure used PharmacoGx described PharamcoSet class, inherited CoreGx::CoreSet. Inspired SummarizedExperiment class, new data structure class called TreatmentResponseExperiment developed store drug response data within PharmacoSet. collaboration BHKLab, developed functionality convert gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment (MAE) object PharmacoSet object (see ConvertingPharmacoSetToGDR vignette convert PharmacoSet gDR object).

title: Converting a gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment object into a PharmacoSet
text: workflow assumes already generated MAE object using gDR package. load MAE object generated using data KW. Song et al, 2022 study. MAE contains two drugs (treatments) 7 cell lines (samples).
code: (mae <- qs::qread(     system.file("extdata", "kyung2022mae", "MAE_E2.qs", package = "gDRimport")   ) ) #> A MultiAssayExperiment object of 2 listed #>  experiments with user-defined names and respective classes. #>  Containing an ExperimentList class object of length 2: #>  [1] matrix: SummarizedExperiment with 1 rows and 7 columns #>  [2] single-agent: SummarizedExperiment with 2 rows and 7 columns #> Functionality: #>  experiments() - obtain the ExperimentList instance #>  colData() - the primary/phenotype DataFrame #>  sampleMap() - the sample coordination DataFrame #>  `$`, `[`, `[[` - extract colData columns, subset, or experiment #>  *Format() - convert into a long or wide DataFrame #>  assays() - convert ExperimentList to a SimpleList of matrices #>  exportClass() - save data to flat files

what: Converting the MAE object into a PharmacoSet object
title: Converting a gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment object into a PharmacoSet
text: First view experiments assays within MultiAssayExperiment object. now convert MAE object PharmacoSet object. need provide name data object, example use name study. can now view PharmacoSet object. can view information drugs cell lines PharmacoSet object using treatment sample slots:
code: gDRutils::MAEpply(mae, assays) #> $matrix #> List of length 14 #> names(14): RawTreated Controls Normalized ... CIScore_50 CIScore_80 Metrics #>  #> $`single-agent` #> List of length 5 #> names(5): RawTreated Controls Normalized Averaged Metrics pset <- convert_MAE_to_PSet(mae, pset_name="Kyung2022") pset #> <PharmacoSet> #> Name:  Kyung2022  #> Date Created:  Wed Feb 14 12:20:43 2024  #> Number of samples:  7  #> Molecular profiles: #>    A MultiAssayExperiment object of 1 listed #>    experiment with a user-defined name and respective class. #>    Containing an ExperimentList class object of length 1: #>    [1] emptySE: SummarizedExperiment with 0 rows and 7 columns  #> Treatment response: #>    <TreatmentResponseExperiment>  #>   dim:  3 7  #>   assays(14): RawTreated Controls Normalized Averaged SmoothMatrix BlissExcess #>     HSAExcess all_iso_points isobolograms BlissScore HSAScore CIScore_50 #>     CIScore_80 Metrics  #>   rownames(3): G02001876_Palbociclib_CDK4|CDK6_168 G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_168 G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_G02001876_Palbociclib_CDK4|CDK6_vehicle_vehicle_168  #>   rowData(10): treatmentid Gnumber DrugName ... title: Converting a gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment object into a PharmacoSet
text: TreatmentResponseExperiment new class developed store drug response data within PharmacoSet object. vignette cover basics class, however information, please refer PharmacoSet vignette TreatmentResponseExperiment****.

title: Converting a gDR-generated MultiAssayExperiment object into a PharmacoSet
text: addition regex queries, TreatmentResponseExperiment object supports arbitrarily complex subset queries using data.table API. access API, need use . function, allows pass raw R expressions evaluated inside j arguments dataTable[, j]. example want subset rows cell line “CL131891_EFM-19_Breast_EFM-19_unknown_64” drug “G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_168”. can also invert matches subset columns rowData colData:
code: tre[   .(treatmentid=="G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_168"), # query on row   .(sampleid=="CL131891_EFM-19_Breast_EFM-19_unknown_64") # query on column ] #> <TreatmentResponseExperiment>  #> dim:  1 1  #> assays(14): RawTreated Controls Normalized Averaged SmoothMatrix BlissExcess #>   HSAExcess all_iso_points isobolograms BlissScore HSAScore CIScore_50 #>   CIScore_80 Metrics  #> rownames(1): G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_168  #> rowData(10): treatmentid Gnumber DrugName ... DrugName_3 drug_moa_3 Duration  #> colnames(1): CL131891_EFM-19_Breast_EFM-19_unknown_64  #> colData(7): sampleid clid CellLineName ... parental_identifier subtype ReferenceDivisionTime  #> metadata(0): none tre[   .(treatmentid!="G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_168"), # query on row   .(sampleid!="CL131891_EFM-19_Breast_EFM-19_unknown_64") # query on column ] #> <TreatmentResponseExperiment>  #> dim:  2 6  #> assays(14): RawTreated Controls Normalized Averaged SmoothMatrix BlissExcess #>   HSAExcess all_iso_points isobolograms BlissScore HSAScore CIScore_50 #>   CIScore_80 Metrics  #> rownames(2): G02001876_Palbociclib_CDK4|CDK6_168 G02967907_GDC-0077_PI3K-A_G02001876_Palbociclib_CDK4|CDK6_vehicle_vehicle_168  #> rowData(10): treatmentid Gnumber DrugName ... DrugName_3 drug_moa_3 Duration  #> colnames(6): CL129757_MCF-7_Breast_MCF-7_unknown_30 CL130218_BT-474_Breast_BT-474_unknown_70 CL130742_T-47D_Breast_T-47D_unknown_60 CL131438_CAMA-1_Breast_CAMA-1_unknown_53 CL131873_HCC1428_Breast_HCC1428_unknown_74 CL131903_BT-483_Breast_BT-483_unknown_130  #> colData(7): sampleid clid CellLineName ... parental_identifier subtype ReferenceDivisionTime  #> metadata(0): none

title: Converting PharmacoSet Drug Response Data into gDR object
text: gDRimport package part gDR suite. helps prepare raw drug response data downstream processing. mainly contains helper functions importing/loading/validating dose response data provided different scanner sources. collaboration BHKLab, gDRimport also provides functions can convert PharmacoGx::PharamcoSet object gDR object. functionality, users familiar gDR suite packages methods can utilize publically available, curated datasets PharmacoGx database. main step process extract drug dose-response data PharmacoSets transform data.table can used input gDRcore::runDrugResponseProcessingPipeline.

title: Converting PharmacoSet Drug Response Data into gDR object
text: Whereas user might already pharmacoset loaded R session, wish obtain different pharmacoset use script future provide helper function . helps user directory store pharmacosets, passing directory function parameter, function also check see PSet exists user-defined directory. ensure PSet re-downloaded already .

what: Converting PharmacoSet to data.table for gDR pipeline
title: Converting PharmacoSet Drug Response Data into gDR object
text: PharamcoSets hold data pertaining cell lines (@sample slot), drugs (@treatment slot), dose response experiments (@treatmentResponse slot). dose response data stored treatmentResponseExperiment object function gDRimport::convert_pset_to_df extracts information build data.table can used input gDR pipeline.
code: # Store treatment response data in df_  dt <- convert_pset_to_df(pharmacoset = pset) str(dt) #> Classes 'data.table' and 'data.frame':   34516 obs. of  7 variables: #>  $ Barcode              : chr  "PCM-0103090_1_130695_2018-08-28" "PCM-0103090_1_130695_2018-08-28" "PCM-0103090_1_130695_2018-08-28" "PCM-0103090_1_130695_2018-08-28" ... #>  $ ReadoutValue         : num  75.7 63.1 75.9 87.2 78.8 ... #>  $ Concentration        : num  0.0021 0.0052 0.01 0.0299 0.0798 ... #>  $ Clid                 : chr  "130695" "130695" "130695" "130695" ... #>  $ DrugName             : chr  "Ivosidenib" "Ivosidenib" "Ivosidenib" "Ivosidenib" ... #>  $ Duration             : num  48 48 48 48 48 48 48 48 48 48 ... #>  $ ReferenceDivisionTime: logi  NA NA NA NA NA NA ... #>  - attr(*, ".internal.selfref")=<externalptr>

title: Converting PharmacoSet Drug Response Data into gDR object
text: canonical PharmacoSets data pertaining many cell lines response many drugs (drug-combination data available conversion gDR currently supported). , interest time resources, may useful subset data providing input gDR pipeline.

what: Running drug response pipeline with data
title: Converting PharmacoSet Drug Response Data into gDR object
text: subsetted data can now used input gDRcore::runDrugResponseProcessingPipeline(). output function MultiAssayExperiment object can accessed gDRutils::convert_se_assay_to_dt()
code: # RUN DRUG RESPONSE PROCESSING PIPELINE se <- gDRcore::runDrugResponseProcessingPipeline(x) se # Convert Summarized Experiments to data.table  # Available SEs : "RawTreatred", "Controls", "Normalized", "Averaged", "Metrics"  str(gDRutils::convert_se_assay_to_dt(se[[1]], "Averaged")) str(gDRutils::convert_se_assay_to_dt(se[[1]], "Metrics"))

text: gDRimport package part gDR suite. helps prepare raw drug response data downstream processing. mainly contains helper functions importing/loading/validating dose response data provided different file formats.

title: gDRimport
text: currently four test datasets can used see ’s expected input data gDRimport.
code: # primary test data td1 <- get_test_data() summary(td1) ##        Length         Class          Mode  ##             1 gdr_test_data            S4 td1 ## class: gdr_test_data  ## slots: manifest_path result_path template_path ref_m_df ref_r1_r2 ref_r1 ref_t1_t2 ref_t1 # test data in Tecan format td2 <- get_test_Tecan_data() summary(td2) ##          Length Class  Mode      ## m_file   1      -none- character ## r_files  1      -none- character ## t_files  1      -none- character ## ref_m_df 1      -none- character ## ref_r_df 1      -none- character ## ref_t_df 1      -none- character # test data in D300 format td3 <- get_test_D300_data() summary(td3) ##        Length Class  Mode ## f_96w  6      -none- list ## f_384w 6      -none- list # test data obtained from EnVision td4 <- get_test_EnVision_data() summary(td4) ##            Length Class  Mode      ## m_file      1     -none- character ## r_files    28     -none- character ## t_files     2     -none- character ## ref_l_path  1     -none- character

title: gDRimport
text: load_data key function. wraps load_manifest, load_templates load_results functions supports different file formats.
code: ml <- load_manifest(manifest_path(td1)) summary(ml) ##         Length Class      Mode ## data     4     data.table list ## headers 26     -none-     list t_df <- load_templates(template_path(td1)) summary(t_df) ##    WellRow           WellColumn          Gnumber          Concentration      ##  Length:768         Length:768         Length:768         Length:768         ##  Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   ##  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character   ##   Gnumber_2         Concentration_2      Template         ##  Length:768         Length:768         Length:768         ##  Class :character   Class :character   Class :character   ##  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Mode  :character r_df <- suppressMessages(load_results(result_path(td1))) summary(r_df) ##    Barcode            WellRow            WellColumn     ReadoutValue     ##  Length:4587        Length:4587        Min.   : 1.00   Min.   :  12627   ##  Class :character   Class :character   1st Qu.: 6.50   1st Qu.:  67905   ##  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Median :12.00   Median : 140865   ##                                        Mean   :12.49   Mean   : 263996   ##                                        3rd Qu.:18.00   3rd Qu.: 324707   ##                                        Max.   :24.00   Max.   :2423054   ##  BackgroundValue ##  Min.   :332.0   ##  1st Qu.:351.0   ##  Median :374.0   ##  Mean   :453.2   ##  3rd Qu.:570.0   ##  Max.   :704.0 l_tbl <-   suppressMessages(     load_data(manifest_path(td1), template_path(td1), result_path(td1))) summary(l_tbl) ##            Length Class      Mode ## manifest   4      data.table list ## treatments 7      data.table list ## data       5      data.table list

Convert MultiAssayExperiment to TreatmentResponseExperiment — convert_MAE_to_PSet
text: function converts MultiAssayExperiment generated gDR TreatmentResponseExperiment use PharmacoGx package. resulting PharmacoSet can used pharmacogenomic analysis drug response.

title: Convert MultiAssayExperiment to TreatmentResponseExperiment — convert_MAE_to_PSet
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object generated gDR. pset_name character string specifying name resulting PharmacoSet object.

title: Convert MultiAssayExperiment to TreatmentResponseExperiment — convert_MAE_to_PSet
code: # Convert a MultiAssayExperiment object to a PharmacoSet object m <- 20 n <- 10 rnames <- LETTERS[1:m] cnames <- letters[1:n] ref_gr_value <-  matrix(runif(m * n), nrow = m, ncol = n, dimnames = list(rnames, cnames)) se <- SummarizedExperiment::SummarizedExperiment(assays = list(RefGRvalue = ref_gr_value),                                                  rowData = S4Vectors::DataFrame(rnames),                                                  colData = S4Vectors::DataFrame(cnames)) mae <- MultiAssayExperiment::MultiAssayExperiment(experiments = list("single-agent" = se)) convert_MAE_to_PSet(mae, "my_pset") #> <PharmacoSet> #> Name:  my_pset  #> Date Created:  Wed Feb 14 12:20:20 2024  #> Number of samples:  10  #> Molecular profiles: #>    A MultiAssayExperiment object of 1 listed #>    experiment with a user-defined name and respective class. #>    Containing an ExperimentList class object of length 1: #>    [1] emptySE: SummarizedExperiment with 0 rows and 10 columns  #> Treatment response: #>    <TreatmentResponseExperiment>  #>   dim:  20 10  #>   assays(1): RefGRvalue  #>   rownames(20): A B ... S T  #>   rowData(2): treatmentid rnames  #>   colnames(10): a b c ... h i j  #>   colData(2): sampleid cnames  #>   metadata(0): none
